snippet: In his ruling on the Saints’ bounty scandal, the former N.F.L. commissioner Paul Tagliabue created a nuanced decision that offered a chance for everyone to claim at least a portion of victory.
abstract: Judy Battista On Pro Football column asserts that Paul Tagliabue's decision to vacate the bounty-related suspensions of four New Orleans Saints players, while surprising, was good for the NFL; says that decision re-oriented blame on coaches and managers while avoiding an appeals process that could have limited the authority of NFL commissioner Roger Goodell.
lead_paragraph: In his ruling on the Saints’ bounty scandal, the former N.F.L. commissioner Paul Tagliabue created a nuanced decision that offered a chance for everyone to claim at least a portion of victory.

headline.seo: Paul Tagliabue’s Saints Ruling Offers Criticism, and Closure
headline.main: Tagliabue’s Ruling Offers Criticism, and Closure
headline.print_headline: Tagliabue’s Ruling Offers Criticism, And Closure
